business.headline: Is the IPO craze over? Stock market correction hits public listingsSubscription figures for IPOs have dropped in recent months. Global economic uncertainty, rising interest rates, and tighter liquidity have made investors cautious.

NTPC Green Energy IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingNTPC Green Energy is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTPC Ltd, focusing on renewable energy projects through both organic growth and acquisitions.
I don't believe in work-life balance: Narayana MurthyNarayana Murthy said that hard work is key to national progress, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's long work hours as an example.

Rs 1 lakh investment now worth Rs 8 lakh: Check this LIC-backed penny stockATV Projects India has shown remarkable growth over recent years, making it one of the standout multibagger stocks in the Indian market. Since the start of 2024, the stock has risen by over 110%, moving from Rs 15.25 to Rs 32.50 per share.

Stock markets in correction phase: More turbulence ahead on Dalal Street?The Sensex and Nifty have tumbled nearly 10% from their recent peaks, leaving investors wondering: Is this just a healthy pause, or should they brace for more turbulence?

SBI hikes home loan interest rates by 5 basis points. Check details  The change in interest rates is effective from November 15, and will make borrowing costs slightly higher for customers seeking loans from the State Bank of India (SBI).

Signature Global shares at over Rs 2,000? These 2 brokerages are bullishShares of Signature Global rose nearly 3.5% in the previous trading session after multiple brokerages raised their target price. Its total market capitalisation stands at 18,238.99 crore.
Piyush Goyal wants RBI to cut interest rates. Shaktikanta Das respondsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal described the link between food inflation and interest rates as an 'absolutely flawed theory.'

I'll take this with me to grave: Narayana Murthy defends 6-day workweek viewNarayana Murthy, who has been vocal about his views on work ethics and productivity, expressed disappointment over India's move from a six-day workweek to a five-day one in 1986.

'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Report flags Starlink's US military tiesStarlink operates through a constellation of satellites to provide internet access worldwide, a model distinct from traditional telecom services that rely on ground-based towers.

Stock markets closed today for Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday?Sensex and Nifty, have faced a six-session losing streak, marked by selling pressure from foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and worries over rising retail inflation.
Siemens layoffs: Tech giant may cut up to 5,000 jobs amid ongoing strugglesThe company's Q4 FY 2024 results highlighted the impact of global geopolitical and macroeconomic challenges.

Sensex, Nifty fall for 6th straight session as FMCG stocks decline sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 110.64 points lower at 77,580.31 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.35 points to 23,532.70.

More trouble for Ola Electric, faces probe over poor service standards: ReportThis comes after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) issued a notice to the SoftBank-backed e-scooter maker following a high volume of complaints.

Boeing layoffs: Aerospace giant to reduce workforce by 17,000Boeing Layoffs: The aerospace giant has faced financial challenges this year, pushing it to make these deep cuts to realign its current financial realities.
Markets in free fall: These sectors and stocks can be safe betsBoth the Sensex and Nifty indices have fallen around 10% from their 52-week peaks, marking a notable slump in the market.
Donald Trump's crypto push: Not just Bitcoin, even these tokens are soaringThe bull run is not only crucial in terms of Bitcoin's valuation but also in its wider impact on the altcoin market.

Trump factor, FII selling: Why Sensex, Nifty fell for 6th straight sessionThe benchmark Sensex dropped over 250 points, while the Nifty fell over 100 points during intraday trade, marking a significant 10% decline from their September peaks.

Can you expect major income tax changes in Budget 2025? Check detailsThe Finance Ministry has established 22 specialised sub-committees to examine various aspects of the Income Tax Act, with an aim to simplify tax structures, expand tax base, and balance revenue generation.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 10 newborns dead in Jhansi hospital blaze, expired fire extinguishers foundJhansi Hospital Fire: An eyewitness told India Today that the fire broke out after a nurse lit a matchstick inside the ward to fix the pipe of an oxygen cylinder.

Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul LIVE on Netflix, Updates: Jake wobbles Tyson in Round 3Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul Live Updates: Mike Tyson vs Jake Paul fight has begun. Earlier, Neeraj Goyat won the opening fight of the night at the AT&T Arena in Texas. After Goyat, Barrios vs Ramos ended in a draw, Serrano lost the co-main event by a controversial split decision.

Actor Disha Patani's father, promised of government post, duped of Rs 25 lakhJagdish Patani was duped out of Rs 25 lakh by a five-member gang, who promised him a government position in exchange for the money but later threatened him when he demanded a refund.

Bodies of woman, 2 children found in Manipur amid hostage crisis: SourcesThree of the six people allegedly kidnapped from a relief camp in Manipur's Jiribam after a gunfight between militants and security forces were found dead on Saturday in Jirimukh near the Assam-Manipur border.

In Ooty: A burst of colours and calm right in the middle of tea gardensVibrant, rich colours are a way of life in Ooty. When you embark on the 2-hour journey from Coimbatore to this hill station, the vibrant fest begins right there.

Who is Karoline Leavitt, set to be youngest White House press secretary at 27?Karoline Leavitt, who gained recognition for her strong defence of Donal Trump in the media, will become the youngest White House press secretary.

Rohit Sharma and Ritika Sajdeh blessed with baby boy: SourcesIndian captain Rohit Sharma and wife Ritika Sajdeh have been blessed with a baby boy, sources have confirmed to India Today. It remains to be seen if Rohit will make himself available for the 1st Test vs Australia in Perth.

7 dead as SUV veers into another lane while trying to overtake, hits auto in UPSix family members and an autorickshaw driver were killed in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor when a Hyundai Creta, overtaking another vehicle, collided with their autorickshaw on Saturday.

Can you be a Mike Tyson like he is at 58, or is he a freak of nature?The 58-year-old Mike Tyson is set to face 27-year-old Jake Paul in the ring on Saturday. But research shows cognitive and physical degeneration at around 40, which prohibit contact sports at that age. Experts and research tell us if 'Iron Mike' is an exception or if we, too, can be in the ring at 58.

Worried about missing father, children in US track his iPhone, lead cops to bodyThe children, concerned for their father's well-being, used the iPhone's tracking feature to locate his last known position. When relatives arrived at the location, they discovered Patel's lifeless body with severe head injuries.

Biryani was served to Kasab after 26/11 Mumbai attacks: JP Nadda slams CongressAddressing a poll rally in Thane, JP Nadda slammed Congress for mishandling national security during the UPA era, citing the 26/11 attacks. He praised PM Modi's decisive actions during incidents such as the Uri and Pulwama attacks.

Ibrahim Ali Khan, Palak Tiwari's Maldives pics convince fans they are datingIbrahim Ali Khan and Palak Tiwari sparked dating rumours once again as they shared vacation photos from the same Maldives resort.

Haka erupts in New Zealand Parliament: Maori fight for their rights | The Culture ProjectIn an extraordinary display of unity and defiance, Maori MPs and spectators erupted into a powerful haka in New Zealand parliament, protesting a controversial bill threatening Indigenous rights. Discover the history of the haka, its deep cultural significance, and the centuries-old struggles of the Maori people. From the Treaty of Waitangi to modern-day battles for justice, this episode of The Culture Project dives into the story behind the protest that captured the world's attention.

On a record-breaking evening in Johannesburg, India completed a memorable series win and ended a memorable year in T20Is on a high.

Video: Passengers scream in terror as extreme turbulence hits US-bound flightDramatic video footage from Scandinavian Airlines Flight 957 captured the severity of the turbulence, showing passengers screaming and loose items such as bags and paper cups flung across the cabin.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Bengal 'tab scam': 1,900 students defrauded, 93 complaints filed as probe widensThe West Bengal Police has registered 93 FIRs and arrested 11 people in connection with the fraud. Investigation has revealed the involvement of gangs operating across multiple states, including Maharashtra, Rajasthan, and Jharkhand.

Air pollution is the leading cause of COPD: Why is this lung disease deadlyDelhi's air pollution has reached severe levels, raising health concerns for those with chronic respiratory diseases like COPD.

Watch: Ronaldo scores from bicycle kick as Portugal beat Poland 5-1Cristiano Ronaldo scored via a bicycle kick in Portugal's Nations League match against Poland. The talisman guided his team into the quarter-final of the competition.

Delhi's AQI remains 'severe' for fourth straight day, smog chokes cityAs of 8 AM on Saturday, the 24-hour AQI stood at 406, according to the Central Pollution Control Board. While the AQI improved slightly to the 'very poor' category yesterday evening, it deteriorated again overnight due to reduced wind speeds and high humidity levels.

Indians going to US for master's degree a scam? Reddit user sparks stormA Reddit user, claiming to be a 26-year-old American woman, said 99% of the students in her computer science master's degree class were Indians. She asked if Indians going to the US for masters was a scam and sparked a massive debate on Reddit and X. People, including tech influencer Deedy Das, revealed the ground reality.

Tamil director Suresh Sangaiah dies due to liver failure, tributes pour inTamil director Suresh Sangaiah, known for helming Oru Kidayin Karunai Manu, died on Friday, November 15, after battling liver failure at a Chennai hospital.

Linkin Park's From Zero review: No, Emily Armstrong is not the new Chester BenningtonLinkin Park has made a daring comeback years after Chester Bennington's death, introducing Emily Armstrong as the new frontwoman on their latest album, From Zero. The album, released on November 15, features 11 tracks that blend nostalgia with a fresh direction.

Alcaraz lost to Alexander Zverev in straight sets in his final group-stage match on Friday in Turin.

Watch: Fan in tears after Samson's six hits her on face in JohannesburgSanju Samson's century powered India to their highest-ever T20I total in South Africa, but a towering six that struck a fan added an emotional moment to the record-filled fourth match against the Proteas in Johannesburg.

In Stats: Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma smash world records in Johannesburg T20I blitz South Africa vs India, 4th T20I: Sanju Samson became the first man to hit three T20I hundreds in a calendar year as India posted their second-highest total of 283 in T20is on Friday. Tilak Varma smashed 120, the second-highest score by an Indian in T20is.

SA vs IND: Tilak Varma emulates Sanju Samson to hit 2 consecutive T20I hundredsTilak Varma emulated Sanju Samson to hit 2 consecutive T20I hundreds. He reached the three-figure mark within 41 balls, making him the 3rd fastest centurion in the format among Indians.

SA vs IND: Sanju Samson becomes 2nd man to hit 2 T20I hundreds in a seriesSouth Africa vs India, 4th T20I: Sanju Samson became only the second man in the history of T20I cricket to score more than one century in a bilateral series on Friday, November 15. Samson hit his third hundred in his last five matches in the format.

IPL 2025 mega auction timings announced: Will it clash with Perth Test?The IPL 2025 mega-auction coincides with India's Test series against Australia, setting the stage for an action-packed week as the BCCI announces a 574-player shortlist and logistics overlap with the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Perth.

IPL auction: BCCI announces shortlist of 574 players, 204 slots to be filledThe BCCI announced the shortlisted 574 players who will go under the hammer in the IPL 2025 mega auction. Out of 574 players, 364 are Indians who will get a chance to be sold in the auction.

4th T20I Highlights: India clinch series by 3-1 after 135-run win in JohannesburgSouth Africa (SA) vs India (IND), 4th T20I Highlights: India have won the T20I series against South Africa in a dominant fashion after their 135-run win over the Proteas in the Johannesburg clash. Starting with Sanju Samson and Tilak Verma's record-filled centuries in the first innings, the likes of Axar Patel and Arshdeep Singh did their job with the ball to script a historic win.

BCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla reiterates India's stance on Champions TrophyBCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla reiterated India's stance on the ICC Champions Trophy situation and claimed that the board will act according to advice from the Indian government. India is refusing to travel to Pakistan for the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
